intro: Manisuris tessellata, commonly known as the tessellated manisuris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking, geometrically patterned leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forest understory environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
